triples.name: Sliding mode control
triples.relevance: Sliding mode control is the primary control technique used and extended in this paper for networked fuzzy systems.

triples.name: Networked control system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses control systems with communication networks integrating time delays and bandwidth constraints.

triples.name: Fuzzy control system
triples.relevance: Takagi-Sugeno fuzzy systems are the core framework used for modeling the plant dynamics in this work.

triples.name: Singular perturbation
triples.relevance: Singularly perturbed systems analysis is used to handle systems with different time scales in the control design.

triples.name: Quantization (signal processing)
triples.relevance: Logarithmic quantizers are employed to process measurement outputs and reduce bandwidth requirements.

triples.name: Lyapunov stability
triples.relevance: Lyapunov theory is the fundamental approach used to prove asymptotic stability of the closed-loop system.

triples.name: H-infinity methods in control theory
triples.relevance: H-infinity performance specifications are used to bound the disturbance effects on system performance.

triples.name: Discrete time and continuous time
triples.relevance: The paper focuses on discrete-time system formulation rather than continuous-time systems.

triples.name: State observer
triples.relevance: Observer-based technique is used to estimate system states for controller design when full state measurement is unavailable.

triples.name: Robust control
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a robust control method that guarantees stability and H-infinity performance despite network uncertainties and parameter variations.
